title: Quiz 4: Trial, Judgment and Execution
description: Final quiz covering the Trial process, Judgments, Decrees, and methods of Execution including Garnishee.

questions.question: In a civil trial, who generally has the 'Right to Begin'?

options.text: The party with the most witnesses

questions.explanation: The Plaintiff has the right to begin unless the defendant admits the facts but argues a point of law.

questions.question: Arrange the Case Management Conferences in chronological order:

items.text: Case Conference (within 30 days of close of pleadings)

questions.explanation: Case Conference -> Settlement Conference -> Trial Conference (Order 11).
questions.hint: First you organize, then try to settle, then prepare for trial.

questions.question: Attachment of salary is a mode of execution, but the amount attached shall not exceed ___BLANK___ of the salary.
questions.explanation: Section 44 of the Civil Procedure Act limits attachment to 1/3 of the salary.
questions.hint: A fraction representing one part of three.

questions.question: Which of the following are valid modes of execution of a decree? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Section 38 lists delivery of property, attachment, arrest, receiver appointment, etc.
questions.hint: Civil law focuses on restitution and compensation, not corporal punishment.

questions.question: Match the Execution Term with its definition:

pairs.right: Person in whose favor judgment is passed
Person against whom execution is sought
Third party holding money owed to Judgment Debtor
Formal expression of adjudication capable of execution

questions.hint: The Garnishee is the 'bank' or employer.

questions.question: What is the immediate effect of a 'Garnishee Order Nisi'?

options.text: It compels the bank to pay the Decree Holder immediately
It freezes the account/debt so the Garnishee cannot pay the Judgment Debtor
It transfers the money to the court automatically

questions.explanation: Order Nisi is a 'show cause' order that freezes the funds (attaches the debt) pending the absolute order.
questions.hint: It creates a freeze or equitable charge.

questions.question: To enforce a judgment against the Government, the Decree Holder must apply for a specific document. What is it called?
questions.explanation: Execution against government requires a Certificate of Satisfaction served on the Accounting Officer (Government Proceedings Act).
questions.hint: It certifies that the government has a debt to satisfy.

questions.question: A judgment delivered by a judge who did not write it (e.g., successor) is invalid.
questions.explanation: Order 21 rule 2 allows a judge to pronounce a judgment written and signed by a predecessor.
questions.hint: What happens if a judge is transferred after writing the judgment but before reading it?

questions.question: Which of the following describes 'Objector Proceedings'?

options.text: Proceedings where a defendant objects to the plaint
Proceedings where a third party claims attached property belongs to them, not the JD
Proceedings to object to the judge hearing the case

questions.explanation: Objector proceedings (Order 22 rule 51) occur when a third party claims ownership of property attached in execution.
questions.hint: Someone saying 'Hey, that's mine, not the debtor's!'

questions.question: Execution of a decree for the payment of money may be by detention in prison. The maximum period for such civil imprisonment is usually ___BLANK___ months.
questions.explanation: Civil imprisonment for debt is generally limited to 6 months.
